metadata.title: CVE-2017-15715 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In Apache httpd 2.4.0 to 2.4.29, the expression specified in <FilesMatch>could match '$' to a newline character in a malicious filename, rather thanmatching only the end of the filename. This could be exploited inenvironments where uploads of some files are are externally blocked, butonly by matching the trailing portion of the filename.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15715` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8').
